accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: The War of 1812 Papers are open for research.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright of papers in the collection may be held by their authors, or the authors' heirs or assigns. Researchers must obtain the written permission of the holder(s) of copyright and the Buffalo History Museum before publishing quotations from materials in the collection.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The manuscripts in this collection were acquired or received by the Buffalo History Museum from many sources between 1865 and 1953. Provenance information for most items has been lost, but whenever possible, items of like provenance have been kept together. The series groupings outlined below reflect subjects or types of documents.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection reprocessed and retroconverted by Peter Nelson, November 1992.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Located close to the U.S./Canadian border, Buffalo's role in the War of 1812 is historically significant to the Western New York area.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: General orders, proclamations, newspaper reports and letters concerning military campaigns, including papers of Maj. John G. Camp; letterbook of Sir Phineas Riall, 1813-1814; minutes and subscription lists, 1814, of the Committee of Safety and Relief at Canandaigua, and other documents of property losses on the Niagara Frontier; rough draft of a treaty arranging for indemnification for slaves and property seized by British forces, 1822; military commissions and papers related to bounty and pension claims of soldiers and their descendants, 1810-1934; an account of Buffalo's role in the War of 1812 by Laila F. Culbertson, 1899; and ms. catalogs, bibliographies, and an inventory of the A. Conger Goodyear War of 1812 collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Organized into four series:
I. Military Campaigns and Treaties, 1812-1925
II. Losses, Claims and Payments to Niagara Frontier War Victims, 1813-1842
III. Commission, Bounty and Pension Papers, 1810-1934
IV. Reminiscences, Catalogs and Bibliographies, 1899-circa 1953. Chronological arrangement within series.
